page.title: 16COMMUNICATIONS IN BROCKWORTH
page.content: There are lots of modern ways of communicating apart from reading, writing and speaking-not least for blind and deaf people.Our survey found that 98% of people have a {'phone} (46% more than 1);mums use the phone more than the rest of the family.An average length call is about 5 mins.-most calls were personal rather than for business. {Home computer} ownership is at about 30% (as is {video});94% listen to {radio} or watch {TV} in the morning;82% have a {newspaper} delivered (of those,a half have the local afternoon paper-The Citizen- but not a national daily). National radio was listened to by 75%; (Radio 1"pop"music station);20%listened to local commercial radio (Severn Sound) whilst no family preferred to listen to Radio 3 or Radio 4.
